items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 22 December 2025  
River levels on the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon and Dauntsey Brook remain high but are slowly dropping today.  Areas most at risk include low lying land and roads around Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham and roads near Reybridge. This Flood Alert will be in force today; we are not expecting any new flood warnings for the Upper Avon at this time. The weather outlook currently shows more showers for the week ahead but no significant rain storms. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 10:27AM on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Trent from Cromwell Weir to Gainsborough
items.message: High tides today and tomorrow may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible. Areas most at risk are Church Laneham to Rampton Road. No further is forecast. River levels at Torksey Gauge are steady and pose a flood risk to low-lying areas and roads. Levels will remain high until 25/12/25. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water & avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 09:00 on 23/12/2025 or as the situation changes.

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road and Sileby Mill road, and farmlands at Cossington, Sileby, Barrow, Quorndon and Cotes. No further rainfall is forecast. River levels at Pillings Lock Gauge have peaked, but levels remain high. Levels will remain high until 24 December 2025. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 09:30 on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Churn, Hilcot Brook, Daglingworth Stream, Gumstool Brook

items.message:
Flooding remains possible.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue, river levels along the River Churn remain high, particularly in Cerney Wick. The weather forecast is dry Monday night and throughout Tuesday. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue on the lower river Cherwell near Lower Heyford and Thrupp. The weather forecast is dry Monday night and throughout Tuesday. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days although they are falling slowly.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
The flood risk remains.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue as river levels along the River Windrush remain high, particularly in Bourton on the Water, Witney, Standlake and Newbridge. The weather forecast is dry Monday night and throughout Tuesday. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Evenlode from Moreton in Marsh to Cassington and also the River Glyme at Wootton and Woodstock
items.message:
High river levels have led to flooding of land close to the River Glyme. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue on the River Glyme at Woodstock. The river is now flowing within banks on the River Evenlode although water will remain in fields close to the river over the next few days. The weather forecast is dry Monday night and throughout Tuesday. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days, particularly on the River Glyme.  

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 12:00 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.message:
Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 22nd December 2025. 
This information is correct as of 15:45 on Monday 22nd December. The causeway at Sutton Gault has approximately 8 centimetre of water on the road. There are currently no issues on the Welney or Earith causeway. Due to uneven surface of the roads, water may be deeper in places.  
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. 
This message will be updated by 08:00 on Tuesday 23rd December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 22 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Wolverley to Newport. Other locations that may be affected include Market Drayton, Wem, and Rodington. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: River levels remain high but are falling, therefore the risk of flooding remains today, 22/12/2025. There is no further rain forecast. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 11:00 on 23/12/2025, or as the situation changes.

People in this area should take action now and watch your local weather forecast. This message will be updated by 03:00 PM on 23 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible today Monday 22nd December 2025 and over the next few days. 

We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  River levels will remain high over the next few days.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.   

This message will be updated by by 10:00 on Tuesday 23rd December 2025, or as the situation changes. 
Flooding is possible today Monday 22nd December 2025 and over the next few days.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message:
Water levels remain high on the Rivers Yeo and Parrett. With a few showers forecast again this evening.
Low lying land and roads are expected to be most affected by flooding. Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if the drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station exceeds 7.3m; the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86m; Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93m and Muchelney to Drayton above 8.8m. Property flooding is possible above 8.35m. For the latest river and drain levels refer to https://check-for-flooding.service.gov.uk/river-and-sea-levels.
Refer to Somerset Council’s website for any local road closures.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. And we are pumping and operating the Parrett Relief Channel when river levels allow.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 12:00 PM on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 22 December 2025 . 
River levels on the Bristol Avon at Bradford on Avon and Semington Brook at Semington continue to fall. Areas most at risk include low lying land and roads between Melksham and Bathford. This Flood Alert will be in force today; we are not expecting any new flood warnings for the Middle Bristol Avon at this time. The weather outlook currently shows more showers for the week ahead but no significant rain storms. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .

River levels are falling but remain high, therefore the risk of flooding continues on 22 December and over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Severn from Tewkesbury to Gloucester. Locations that may be affected include Apperley, Maisemore, Hempstead, Minsterworth Ham and Quedgeley. Severn Ham, Tewkesbury starts to fill. Predicted peaks:- Mythe peaked at 4.13m on 21/12, Haw Bridge peaked at 4.97m 21/12. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels are falling but remain high, therefore the risk of flooding continues on 22 December and over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Avon from Abbotts Salford to Tewkesbury. Other locations that may be affected include Offenham, Evesham, Twyning and the Eckington Road. Mill Bank Road from Jubilee Bridge to Fladbury may be impacted. Peaks:- Evesham peaked AT 2.8M 19/12 , Bredon peaked at 2.92m 21/12. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by10:00AM on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: River levels remain high today from overnight rain and may lead to flooding. Locations most affected will be Alverthorpe Beck, Balne Beck, Ings Beck and Oakenshaw Beck in Wakefield. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. This message will be updated by 9am tomorrow, Tuesday 23rd December 2025.

The flood forecast has changed significantly. As a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.message:
River levels remain high on the River Derwent following recent rainfall. As a result, flooding is possible today, Monday 22nd December 2025 and overnight.

Locations most affected will be local roads and low-lying land near rivers around Stamford Bridge, Pocklington, Wressle, Wilberfoss and Elvington. 

Levels are expected to fall slowly over the next few days. We are monitoring the forecast and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 8:00AM on Tuesday 23rd December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.message:
High river levels on Monday may lead to flooding.   

Flooding is possible throughout Monday 22 December 2025.   

Rivers remain high following rain this week. Flooding is possible for low lying land and roads around rivers.  The main areas of concern are low lying areas along the River Hayle.   

We are closely monitoring the situation.   

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.   

This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 23 December 2025.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 22 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Cae Howel currently 3.74m and falling slowly.. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Sandyford Brook, Ridings Brook, Saredon Brook

items.message: River levels remain above flood alert thresholds but are falling slowly. Consequently the risk of flooding remains. Flooding may affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Sow between Great Bridgeford and Shugborough, the River Penk between Coven and Stafford, the Sandyford Brook, the Rising Brook, the Ridings Brook and the Saredon Brook. We expect river levels to remain above flood alert thresholds into Tuesday, 23/12/25. We are closely monitoring the situation . Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels continue to remain high and may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible for: Lower Rivers Tone and Parrett including West Moor, Hay Moor, Curry Moor, Stan Moor, Salt Moor and North Moor. The River Tone level at Currymoor pumping station remains high (currently 7.46m). Water is entering Currymoor reservoir via Hookbridge spillway as this level exceeds 7.45m. The drain level at Currymoor pumping station is 6.65m. Cutts Road floods when the drain level at Currymoor pumping station is above 5.75m, and New Road when the level is above 6.18m. Please refer to the latest gauge levels on Check for Flooding and Somerset Council’s website for information on road closures in the area. Drier weather is forecast for the next few days. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Pumping will commence at Currymoor when river levels allow. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels are falling but remain high, therefore the risk of flooding continues on 22 December and over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land & roads adjacent to the river from Highley to Tewkesbury; including Dog Lane Bewdley, Stourport, Diglis & Hylton Road towpath. Flooded drains affect the racecourse & Worcester CCG. PLP should be installed. New St Gate closed at Upton upon Severn. Predicted peaks:- Bewdley peaked at 3.02m 21/12, Worcester peaked at 4.14 20/12, Diglis peaked at 3.91m 20/12, Kempsey Yacht Club peaked 6.03m on 21/12, Saxons Lode peaked at 4.68 21/12. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels are falling but remain high, therefore the risk of flooding continues on 22 December and over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and Squires Walk in the area of the Hatfield Brook Kempsey. Kempsey Flood Alleviation Scheme is operational. Predicted peak:- Kempsey Yacht Club peaked at 6.03m 20/12. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding continues to pose a risk. Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Willington, Barrow upon Trent, Swarkestone, Bargate Lane, and the access roads to Willington Meadows, the Twyford Village access road, Church Lane at Barrow, and Ingleby Lane. No further rainfall is forecast. River levels at Shardlow Gauge and Willington Gauge have peaked and are falling however the risk of flooding still remains. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water & avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 09:00 on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Severn at Chaceley and Haw Bridge
items.message:
The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message: High and rising groundwater levels may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible in the West Dorset area. Groundwater levels are rising in response to recent heavy rainfall. Levels may continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Further rainfall is expected over the next few days which may see levels continue to rise. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. We are closely monitoring the situation . Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message: River and lake levels remain high today, Monday 22 December 2025. Lake levels will continue to fall slowly today, Monday 22 December 2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the rivers Brathay, Rothay, Winster and other watercourses from Grasmere to Grange-over-Sands including low lying areas around Ambleside, Skelwith Bridge, Windermere, Hawkshead, Newby Bridge, Backbarrow, Cark and Cartmel. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths, bridges near local watercourses and do not drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00 am on Tuesday 23rd December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message: River and lake levels remain high today, Monday 22 December 2025. Lake levels will continue to fall slowly today, Monday 22 December 2025 but will remain above flood alert level until later this week. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 10:00 am on Tuesday 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the Cranborne Chase area
items.message:
High groundwater levels may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the 21 December 2025 onwards 
Groundwater levels have risen in response to recent rainfall. Levels are expected to continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. Flooding of roads and fields is possible. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:

Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

River levels have levelled off but remain high due to the recent heavy rainfall. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible. Flooding could still affect locations near the River Piddle, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Alton Pancras and Wareham. There is no significant rain forecast for today. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have and monitor local water levels and weather conditions. This message will be updated by 03:00 PM on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding continues to pose a risk. Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including communities near to the River Trent, and cellars of low-lying properties at Cavendish Bridge. No further rainfall is forecast. River levels at Shardlow Gauge have peaked and are falling however the risk of flooding still remains. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water & avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 09:00 on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Clanfield Brook for Clanfield Village and the Shill Brook for Bampton
items.message:
High river levels have lead to flooding. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible along the Clanfield Brook in the Clanfield area. The weather forecast is dry Monday night and throughout Tuesday. River levels high but are falling and remain responsive to further rain over the coming days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 12:00 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower Frome from East Stoke to Wareham
items.message: River levels remain high from previous heavy rainfall. Flooding is still forecast to affect locations near the Lower Dorset Frome, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around areas in East Stoke, Holmebridge, Stoborough, Stoborough Green, Wareham, Redcliffe, Ridge and Swineham. There is very little rainfall expected today. We are closely monitoring the situation . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High water levels are expected to cause flooding today. Flooding is expected on 22 December 2025 as river levels remain high. Flooding may affect locations near the River Tone, Currymoor Main Drain (currently at 6.69m), with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected. Cutts Road floods when the Currymoor Main Drain is above 5.75m, and New Road as this level is above 6.18m. There is a risk of water overtopping Haymoor flood storage area and affecting Curload and Stan Moor if this level reaches 8.30m. For the latest river and drain levels refer to https://check-for-flooding.service.gov.uk/river-and-sea-levels. River Parrett levels are being managed using the Parrett relief channel. Drier weather is forecast for the next few days. We are closely monitoring the situation and operating our pumping stations when river levels allow. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Refer to @TravelSomerset for information on local road closures. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Thames for Shiplake, Lower Shiplake and Wargrave
items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible overnight 22 December 2025.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible, especially in the Shiplake and Wargrave areas. This is in response to the rainfall over the last few days. Tonight is forecast to be dry. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 19:00 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Thames from Pangbourne to Purley
items.message:
High river levels have led to flooding of land close to the river.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue, as the River Thames remains high. The weather forecast is dry Monday night and throughout Tuesday. We do not expect the river to rise much further, however river levels will remain high over the coming days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected. With no rain in the five day forecast, water levels in Pulborough, Amberley, and Arundel will continue to slowly fall. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and work with emergency services and local authorities. Our staff remain on site at Pulborough with a temporary pump. 
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

Flooding remains possible.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected, especially around Fossebridge and Bibury. The weather forecast is dry Monday night and throughout Tuesday. We expect river levels to remain high and responsive to further rain over the coming days. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Foulness and Market Weighton catchment

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Foulness, Market Weighton Canal, North Cave Beck, Ellerker Beck, Mill Beck

items.message:
River levels remain high following recent rainfall. As a result, flooding is possible today, Monday 22nd December 2025. 

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the River Foulness and the Market Weighton Canal and their tributaries, particularly around Welham Bridge. 

Levels are expected to fall slowly over the next few days. We are monitoring the forecast and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 

This message will be updated by 8:00AM on Tuesday 23rd December 2025, or as the situation changes.

The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

River levels remain high on the River Derwent. As a result, flooding is expected today, Monday 22nd December 2025, and overnight.

Locations most affected will be Buttercrambe Mill at Buttercrambe Bridge. Levels are expected to continue falling over the coming days.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water and start acting on your flood plan if you have one.
 
This message will be updated by 8:00AM on Tuesday 23rd December 2025 or as the situation changes.

This message will be updated by 1pm on the 23rd December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Areas most at risk are around the River Great Ouse from Newport Pagnell to Sharnbrook.   We are not expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time.

items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, Yeovilton to Huish Episcopi
items.message:
Water levels remain high on the Rivers Yeo and Parrett. With a few showers forecast again this evening.
Low lying land and roads are expected to be most affected by flooding, particularly around the A37 south and A303 south west of Ilchester, the Ilchester to Limington road and road to Ilchester Meads. There is also a risk of flooding around Hainbury Mill, Ilchester.
Please refer to the latest gauge levels on Check for Flooding and Somerset Council’s website for information on road closures in the area.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. And we are pumping when river levels allow.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 12:00 PM on 23 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the Cerne Valley
items.message:
High groundwater levels are expected to cause flooding. 
Flooding is expected from the 19th December onwards. 
Groundwater levels in West Dorset remain high. Areas that could be affected include: Charminster and nearby areas. The groundwater level at the Dickley Down borehole has risen to 170m, and is expected to rise over the next few days. Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. Residents may experience inundation of septic tanks and sewer systems. Flooding of roads is expected, and may have become damaged by floodwater.

Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
If you have a pump, make sure it is working and switched on. Think about alternative power sources in case of power cuts . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Flooding is expected from the 19th December 2025 onwards 
Groundwater levels in West Dorset remain high. Areas that could be affected include: Hooke, Toller Whelme and Toller Porcorum. The groundwater level at the Dickley Down borehole has risen to 170m, and is expected to rise over the next few days. Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures. Residents may experience inundation of septic tanks and sewer systems. Flooding of roads is expected, and roads may have become damaged by floodwater.

Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
If you have a pump, make sure it is working and switched on. Think about alternative power sources in case of power cuts . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. Residents may experience inundation of septic tanks and sewer systems. Properties may experience flooding in cellars in affected areas.

Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
If you have a pump, make sure it is working and switched on. Think about alternative power sources in case of power cuts . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding for the South Winterbourne Valley
items.message:
High groundwater levels are expected to cause flooding. 
Flooding is expected from 20th December 2025 onwards 
Groundwater levels in West Dorset remain high. Areas that could be affected include: Winterbourne Abbas, Winterbounre Steepleton, Martinstown, Winterborne Monkton, Winterbourne Herringston and Winterborne Came. The groundwater level at the Kingston Russell borehole has risen to 116.7m, and is expected to continue rising in next few days. Residents may experience inundation of septic tanks and sewer systems. Properties may experience flooding in cellars in affected areas. Flooding of roads is expected, Roads may be damaged by floodwater. intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
If you have a pump, make sure it is working and switched on. Think about alternative power sources in case of power cuts . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.
